title: how do I get the Bookmark side bar from my page?
content: I do not want the Bookmark side bar on my page. I want it on my toolbar only.

title: Stoped recieving emails from my website & outgoing messages are written in large script.
content:
A few months back I stopped receiving emails from my website. I checked with my web designer and he says it's sending correctly. I checked my "Blocked Emails" and it's not there. I entered the address to my "Accept Emails". Still, when we send emails from the "Contact Page" of my website and it shows that it is sent out correctly to my email address, which is a ".com" address, doesn't come to my Inbox nor my Junk/Spam box.

Also, for some strange reason, my "Outgoing" emails that i type to others, is in large script font. I have no idea what is happening with that. I have triple checked my settings.

I want to know why i can't get a customer rep from Firefox to respond to me. I have been complaining and scoring low satisfaction etc... to try to get a response, but ZERO.

Please help, i can't run my business like this. I'm frustrated!

title: Where did my history go?  You all should have NOTIFIED us that we would need to prepare for your drastic change, it is difficult not having prior notice.
content: This was so unfair to make these drastic changes without prior notice. My entire history is gone and I lost a day with clients trying to retrieve my Bookmarks. This will cause many people to not want to donate to you all ever if we are going to be treated like this. My allegiance was full on, without question for Mozilla Firefox, but after this stunt, I can no longer pitch Mozilla Firefox the best above the rest. NOTHING IS THE SAME. And Why do I have to SIGN IN EACH AND EVERY TIME? No longer user friendly.

title: Keep getting messages to upgrade Firefox but it IS updated.
content: ~ Hi, I keep getting messages to update Firefox before June 30 - but it IS up to date. I removed app and reinstalled, but am still getting the message. I contacted one of the websites associated with the message and they said they cannot see that I'm connected to them. But when I use Safari, they can see that I'm connected. These are the two I remember giving the message. - Ebay - Snapfish Please advise how to solve the problem.

title: Blank white window
content: So I recently updated my Firefox on multiple devices (Windows, Linux, Mac). Recently with the update to 67, periodically when I launch the browser it will just show a blank white page and the address bar just says "search with Google or enter address." I can hit the home button and it takes me to my home page. Other times when I launch Firefox it works without issue and takes me directly to my home page. I have browser.startup.blankWindow set to "false" in "about:config," but issue still randomly occurs. Again, this is multiple computers and multiple OSes all encountering this issue. Yes, some have some add-ons/extensions, but others do not and there doesn't seem to be any pattern that I can discern. Anyone else encountering this? Any fix short of uninstalling/reinstalling Firefox. Worked just fine up through 66 (would prefer not to revert back). -Thanks

title: Somebody stole all of my icons on my home page.
content: After years and years of trial and error I finally, (I said finally) got my home page like I want it; with 3 top rows of icons of allllll of the places I regularly visit. Icons may be a incorrect term. It's a little square picture with a f on it and when I wanna go to Facebook I just click on that little square f and go straight to Facebook. Ain't that neat. Well, this morning when I logged in, two of the rows were gone the row that's remaining the squares keep moving around. Anyway, I want my 3 rows back and locked in place like it was yesterday. Probably never happen, huh?

title: Why doesn't printing use the default printer?
content: This bug has been here for ages and having to do periodic resets using about:config every time it goes pair shaped is a bloody annoying time waster. Could someone spend 5 minutes to fix it so it works like every other windows program in the universe that accesses a printer???

title: Leave tabs in place
content: I have Win 10 and Firefox67.0.1. I understand that Firefox has done away with tabbed browsing because some users kept so many tabs open that their memory usage became excessive. I wanted to be able to keep a few tabs open while browsing (email, weather and a few other sites). I tried using the Pin Tab feature but found it would not work for my email or NOAA, though it did work for one Firefox help site. I also tried changing the browser tab item in about:config. (See uploaded image). I am in the process of slowly migrating to a more user friendly browser (Vivaldi), but before I change default browsers I thought I'd try one more time and ask if there is any way to restore the ability to keep a few tabs open in Firefox while browsing. Thanks for any help.

title: Firefox: Saving source URL in downloaded files, images?

title: Firefox resets all customization every time my computer restarts
content: The "Customize..." feature lets you move around icons and other things in Firefox's interface. When you apply these customizations, they *should* be saved in your browser, so that the next time you open Firefox, you have the same customizations you applied earlier. Whenever I restart my computer, these settings are completely reset to their defaults and I have to apply the same customizations every time. How do I fix this???

title: Cannot print from Firefox. Have tried everything in this forum. Error "An error occurred while printing".
content: I have literally tried everything that I've found about printing issues on this forum and even spoken to your team on Twitter. I don't know what to do. I would rather use Firefox over Chrome, but I don't have a choice. Is there anyone that can help??

title: Are you aware of the audio issues with firefox?
content:
My audio in firefox is great starting out. But if i pause a video on youtube, fast forward or rewind the video the sound goes flat. Sometimes i can goto system menu and switch to my monitors speakers and then back to the 5.1 surround system i have and it will fix it. Now that fix doesnt work, the only way to get audio back is to shut down firefox and restart it. Sometimes starting firefox it tells me firefox is still running do i want to shut it down? I do shut it down and the audio comes back. THis has been this way for a wile and i have been testing different things on my system but every thing is pointing to firefox. Internet explorer/edge/chrome has no audio issues at all. 

To explain a little more on what i mean , I can play a video on youtube or netflix/vudu etc etc and audio sounds good lots of bass treble highs lows and then it goes flat. NO bass/treble/highs/lows etc.

what is odd also is my default speakers are set to my 5.1 surround sound and it will get changed to either my monitor speakers or a digital out port which i dont have anything hooked to. It is like firefox coding is getting confused on which set of speakers to play audio to and eventually gives up and settles for a default driver setting?

It may be something other than firefox but as of now, i only get these issues if i use firefox. Thanks.

title: My preferences keep resetting.
content:
This has been happening for a while now. Whenever I turn on my laptop and go to open Firefox, it resets all of my preferences. This is starting to annoy me, especially with dealing with the homepage and setting things back to normal.

I have gone through the steps listed in this article (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-to-fix-preferences-wont-save) but nothing works. I also keep getting the Privacy Notice update in another tab (https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/privacy/firefox/) when I open Firefox as well, which is annoying as well. Would appreciate the help here.

title: Not starting second time
content: On windows 7 64bit firefox always starts fine first time after machine switch-on but recently (~ last 6 months since v65) restarting firefox a second time often (not always) causes nothing to appear on screen but task manager shows that it is running in the background. Today I tried restarting firefox in safe mode (after it exhibited the above behaviour and shutting it down in task manager) and it restarted fine. I then tried restarting firefox in normal mode and it again started ok. I've tried refreshing and reinstalling firefox, turned about:config/browser/tabs.remote.autostart to false but this is still happening intermittently. AdBlockPlus is the only extension installed, shockwave flash the only plugin.

Headline is a simplification. What actually happens is - two different problems:

title: Firefox Monitor - Problem with upper case letters in email adresses?
content:
Hi, I've noticed a very odd behaviour with Firefox Monitor (FM), which I started using today: I 've created my Firefox account quite some time ago using my email address SchmidtSt@web.de (written with 2 upper case "S") as User-ID. When I signed up for FM today, it told me "0 breaches" which I found odd since I know for sure from haveIbeenpwned.com that this email address had been breached on last.fm (and 3 further "unverified" breaches).

So I added another email address I'm using, Schmidt_St@hotmail.com (again, out of habit) written with 2 upper case "S". And again, to my surprise: "0 breaches" -Â ?!? That one, too, had been breached on last.fm, and additionally on Verifications.io.

Thus I tried adding these two email addresses written in lower case only - and guess what? Now it works ...

I think you should fix this, since the UI of haveIbeenpwned.com has no problem with using upper case letters in email addresses (and for email addresses it usually makes no difference if you write them lower or upper case).

Cheers and best regards, Steffen Schmidt.

title: After firefox update I can no longer stream live tv from the bbc website
content:

Any ideas? I'm totally stumped...

content: Firefox keeps saying it cannot continue to create a firefox account because cookies are disabled. I check my cookies setting and cookies setting is standard. Firefox will not create an account because it keeps saying cookies are disable when they are not disabled. I have had to do this using Chrome.

content:

Firefox 67.0.1

title: YTD video downloader / converter not downloading music anymore since upgrade to Mojave??
content: I have been using an application called YTD (YouTube Downloader), for some years now, and recently it has started to not download certain videos on YouTube anymore.... Specifically, it will not download any music videos of songs anymore, but it will still download any other videos that are not music.... This seems to be a new thing, as I recently upgrade from High Sierra to Mojave, and a bunch of old apps. that I use no longer function correctly.... Does anyone else use YTD downloader application, and if so, is there a fix for the Mojave opersating system that will let it work correctly?? Thanks in advance!!

content:

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to ustreamix.su. A required TLS feature is missing. Error code: MOZILLA_PKIX_ERROR_REQUIRED_TLS_FEATURE_MISSING

title: Lost all bookmarks etc on upgrade to 67
content:
Others have asked similar questions but for different platforms and none of the suggestions have either worked, been appropriate for the setup or understood by me (a non programmer!). I am operating High Sierra 10.13.6 and after migrating to Firefox 67 have lost everything to do with previous setup.

When trying to set a previous profile as default I get the error message about launching an older version of Firefox and gives me a quit or new profile option only which is not satisfactory.

Is there not a simple solution to this unasked for level of complication that allows me to restore my existing bookmarks and passwords without delving deep into processes I don't understand and inputting lots of lines of code? It feels like I've taken my car in to fill up the tank and been told to rebuild the engine to get my car going again.

Im inputting this using Chrome because almost every attempt to use firefox causes a crash

All help gratefully received.

title: input device
content:
Hello,

I currently try to get PointerEvent.pressure event working with Wacom device (Wacom Bamboo 16FG) or a custom touchscreen generated with evemu- binaries on Linux Ubuntu 18.04

As far as i understand the code, firefox use GTK 3 to catch input device event. I can't figured out how exactly the device should be declared to Linux, udev or xorg, to allow firefox to catch pressure event and fill the PointerEvent.pressure

Did the PointerEvent.pressure feature have already work on LinuxÂ ? If yes how exactly the device should be described to the Xinput?

Here is my wacom device description according to evemu-describe binary https://pastebin.com/U84uCAru

I also attach a record that could be replayed using evemu-replay that will create a virtual input touchscreen and replay a sequence of BTN_TOUCH/ABS_MT_PRESSURE/ABS_PRESSUREÂ : https://pastebin.com/7RNtCsWZ

Thanks

title: Unable to login to Firefox Monitor (Error must-be-signed-in)
content:
I was adding multiple email addresses to Firefox Monitor on my PC in Chrome. I was signed into my Firefox account. I was able to validate most of them through the initial email that is sent by Monitor. However, after I just tried to validate one of my email addresses, I am given the error message:

Error must-be-signed-in

I then tried to sign in, but it spit out the same error. I tried clearing cookies & cache, used incognito mode, tried Edge & Firefox on my PC, & then tried Firefox on my phone, & I am still given the same error. I even tried using my LTE instead of Wi-Fi to see if it was a network issue. None of this worked, so I am left assuming it's either an issue with my own account or with Firefox Monitor itself.

I tend to use unique email addresses for most of my online accounts using one of my own personal domains, so I ended up loading quite a lot of addresses into Monitor. Is there a limit to the number of addresses that I can add? Or is the problem something else?

Thanks!

title: The same web page is printed on a different computer, but the size is different.
content: The same web page is printed on a different computer, but the size is different. What's the problem? sa.ddns.net/test/px.html The boundaries are all set to 0, and the header and footer are all set to blank. FireFox v67 64 bit Environment 1: Notebook PC 10 1803 Resolution (1366*768) Preview one page when printing. Environment 2: Desktop computer windows 10 1803 resolution (1366*768) becomes two pages when preview printing.

title: "a" key shortcut
content: Whenever I want to search something or type anything in Firefox it will automatically click what ever my cursor is over. This only happens when I press the A key though. I've tested it and it only happens on Firefox, and it doesn't matter what it is that the cursor is hovering over, as long as I press the A key it will register as a click. Is there a way to disable this as It's incredibly frustrating when I'm trying to search something and I end up "clicking" some random Youtube video or link.

title: Trying to upload anything makes Firefox stop responding.  Tried all your resets.  Happening recently for past 6 months maybe.What can I do to fix this?
content: I can't upload anything to anywhere, for instance, photos to Facebook, Viewbug, Zenfolio. Select file opens with no info in it and stops there. Top says "File Upload (Not responding). Of course, when I close with the x, it says I'll lose data or I can wait till I die for Firefox to respond. I can upload just fine on other browers. This started happening a couple months ago after one of the upgrades to Firefox. Prior to that upgrade, Firefox would not load at all. I have tried all the "solutions" on this site, like disabling add-ons, safe mode, no accelerations, changing script time, checking for driver updates, etc. etc. Nothing works. If I put that upload box up, it makes a hang that I can only eliminate by quitting Firefox altogether. Please help.

title: ubuntu firefox 67.0 (64 bit) browser.tabs.warnOnClose not working
content:
Using Firefox 67.0 (64 bit) on Ubuntu MATE 18.04 When closing firefox w/ several tabs open firefox does not prompt w/ a warning (as it did in 66.x.) I checked about:config: all instances of *.tabs.warnOnClose are set to "true", (also "warnOnCloseOtherTabs") yet there is no warning.

Any suggestions gratefully welcomed.

title: Highlights in Home page doesn't show bookmarks after I clear my history
content:
Hi,
